thread.title: Sergio Aguero cagey over Manchester City future despite return to goalscoring form in Monaco win
thread.title_full: Sergio Aguero cagey over Manchester City future despite return to goalscoring form in Monaco win

author: John Cross
title: Sergio Aguero cagey over Manchester City future despite return to goalscoring form in Monaco win
text:
Sport Sergio Aguero cagey over Manchester City future despite return to goalscoring form in Monaco win The Argentine striker had gone six games without finding the net before his Champions League two goal salvo sparking talk of a summer exit Share Sergio Aguero remains in the dark over his City future (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Sergio Aguero has admitted his future at Manchester City is out of his hands. 
Aguero, the two goal hero of City’s dramatic Champions League win over Monaco, insists he wants to stay but claims the club will make a decision in the summer. 
City striker Aguero said: “As I've always said I want to be here at the club, I've always said that at the end of the season it won't be my decision. The truth is that with these things it's the club that handles everything, and obviously it's always my intention to stay. 
“The truth is that those things are for the manager to decide, the only thing I can do is keep fighting to be able to play. Fortunately he counted on me, now I have to help the team and show what I can do.” Read More Aguero scored City's second (Photo: Getty Images) Before adding a second of his own (Photo: Getty) 
Aguero also insisted there is no personality clash between him and Pep Guardiola even though the City boss has made it clear he wants his players to work harder. 
“The truth is we get on very well. What he wants, above everything, from all the players is that we push a little more,” said Aguero. 
“He’s always asking me for more, more, more [looks up and smiles], obviously it's a sacrifice I have to make, that we all have to make, and fortunately tonight it worked and we'll see if it keeps working in the next game.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
